meanings.sent1: Tommy felt like a booby when he forgot his homework at home.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a booby and double-check your work before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The booby in the story always made silly mistakes but learned from them.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a booby standing in line with mismatched socks.
meanings.sent5: Being a booby in class made him the target of many jokes.

meanings.sent1: The booby soared gracefully over the ocean, searching for fish.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a booby perched on a rock near the shore.
meanings.sent3: The booby's distinctive blue feet stood out against its white feathers.
meanings.sent4: The booby dove into the water with precision, catching its prey effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Watching the booby dive was a highlight of the bird-watching trip.

meanings.definition: A type of trap or snare.
meanings.sent1: The hunter set up a booby to catch rabbits in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The booby was cleverly disguised to blend in with the surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The booby was triggered by a simple mechanism hidden in the bushes.
meanings.sent4: The booby snapped shut as soon as the unsuspecting animal stepped on it.
meanings.sent5: The booby was an effective way to catch prey without being detected.
